meta.description: Machine-readable definitions of core HyperSync concepts, entities, and mechanisms.

AcceptanceGate.definition: A logic mechanism in the Geometry Engine that validates state transitions based on their geometric cost and drift. Anomalies trigger consensus reconfiguration.

Agent.definition: Autonomous component that orchestrates operators and manages workflows.

AGUA.definition: The execution supervision and orchestration layer for HyperSync. Enforces Geometry Control Rulesets to ensure system stability.

AttestationValidationReceipt.definition: A specific receipt type required for Core tier users to access op://network/ico/probe.

Barycenter.definition: The geometric 'center of mass' used to compute consensus in hyperbolic space.

BuildReceipt.definition: Cryptographic record of build process and transformations.

CanonicalForm.definition: Unique, standardized representation of data or specification.

ConformanceTest.definition: Test ensuring implementation adheres to specification requirements.

ConsensusTiers.definition: A system of 14 consensus mechanisms integrated across service tiers, following the principle of Installation-based Enforcement.

Curvature.definition: Measure of how space deviates from Euclidean geometry.

DeterminismTiers.definition: Classification system for execution precision and reproducibility.

DeterministicTransformation.definition: Transformation that always produces the same output for the same input.

Drift.definition: The tendency of a node or state to diverge from the consensus center. Naturally penalized by geometry.

EpochTimestamp.definition: Fixed timestamp used for reproducible builds.

Geodesic.definition: Shortest path between two points in hyperbolic space.

Geoticket.definition: A cryptographically signed instruction set for a deterministic path that ignores the manifold geometry.

HVS.definition: The core vector communication and collaboration system of HyperSync. Enables direct vector-to-vector communication between models.

HyperbolicGeometry.definition: Non-Euclidean geometric space used by HyperSync for efficient representation and computation of hierarchical and distributed data structures.

HyperSync.definition: Geometry-aware orchestration and synchronization system for distributed computational workloads using hyperbolic geometry.

Manifest.definition: Living document tracking all files, checksums, and metadata in the specification.

Operator.definition: Atomic computational unit in HyperSync that performs specific transformations or operations.

PCT.definition: The lifecycle framework for developing geometry-aware workflows.

PoincareDisk.definition: Hyperbolic geometry model used for visualization and computation.

Policy.definition: Declarative rules governing system behavior, resource allocation, and operational constraints.

Receipt.definition: Cryptographic proof of computation or transformation, including checksums and transformation chain.

RegionsOfInterest.definition: Dynamically allocated subspaces for specific tenants or workloads, isolated by high-curvature ridges.

SafetyFences.definition: Geodesic polygons that bound the valid state space for an agent. Violation triggers GeometricSingularityError.

ServiceTiers.definition: The tiered access model defining feature sets and licensing.

SignatureReceipt.definition: A specific receipt type required for Core tier users to access op://network/ico/probe.

SingleBaseProgram.definition: Philosophy where the specification is the canonical source of truth, free of build artifacts and patch logs.

SpecFile.definition: Formal specification document defining system behavior or component.

STUNIR.full_name: Standardization Theorem Unique Normal Intermediate Reference
STUNIR.definition: Intermediate representation format ensuring deterministic transformations and providing cryptographic proof.

Vectorization.definition: Process of converting documentation into embeddings for semantic search.

VNES.definition: The universal runtime and development plane for HyperSync where all behaviors are treated as Vector Capsules.

Capsule.definition: Modular unit of functionality in VNES.
